oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Rutherford County Fair Association
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Agricultural exhibits; Agriculture; Horticulture; Livestock; Farm produce; Fairs
Agriculture; Rutherford County (Tenn.); Murfreesboro (Tenn.)
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: A 134 page soft-cover program of the Sixth Annual Fair of the Rutherford County Agriculture Society held near Murfreesboro, Tennessee, beginning on September 10, 1889. The booklet includes lists of stockholders, advertisments, and the agricultural society rules and regulations. A listing of various competition categories is included.
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Rutherford County Fair Association
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Agricutural fairs emerged in the 19th century as an outgrowth of the Tennessee State Agricultural Bureau. As agricultural societies increased in Tennessee, so did the number of county fairs. The primary purpose of the fairs was to encourage the adoption of improved agricultural methods. Farmers entered samples of their crops and livestock to be judged on the basis of an established set of criteria. The fairs also offered entertainment and a chance to socialize with farmers and their
